item.description:
A New Jersey feather has died after eating a hamburger, become the first known fatality from a meat allergy that‚Äôs caused by tick bites.

The 47-year-old victim suffered from alpha-gal syndrome, a rare but increasingly common disease spread by bites from the lone star tick.

According to researchers at the University of Virginia, the otherwise healthy airline pilot was on a camping trip with his wife and children last summer when he ate steak for dinner ‚Äî¬†and woke up hours later with stomach discomfort, diarrhea and vomiting so severe he was writing in pain.

He recovered, but two weeks later, hours after eating a hamburger, he collapsed and ultimately died at a hospital.

A growing number of cases of Alpha-gal syndrome ‚Äî a rare but potentially life-threatening illness that makes people violently allergic to red meat ‚Äî suggest that more tick species may be to blame than initially thought.

Scientists consider lone star ticks the main AGS culprit, but these new cases shift the blame to deer and western black-legged ticks.

This new evidence raises concerns about the spread of AGS, particularly in regions like Long Island, where ticks are a growing problem.

What is alpha-gal syndrome?

AGS is a serious allergic reaction triggered by a sugar molecule called alpha-gal, which is found in most mammalian meat.

When certain ticks bite humans, they can transfer alpha-gal into the bloodstream, causing their victims to develop a severe response to red meat consumption.

The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention estimates that up to 450,000 people in the US have alpha-gal syndrome. Cases have been increasing since 2010, according to the agency.

What are the symptoms of alpha-gal syndrome?

Most people develop symptoms two to six hours after eating red meat products such as beef, pork and lamb.

Some common symptoms include:

  • Itchy skin or rashes
  • Stomach pain, nausea, vomiting or diarrhea
  • Dizziness or fainting
  • Difficulty breathing or anaphylaxis in severe cases

Where are these ticks common?

Most AGS cases are reported in areas the lone star tick calls home, such as the southern, midwestern and mid-Atlantic US.

The CDC has previously singled out Arkansas, Kentucky, Missouri and Suffolk County, New York, as places where the lone star tick is known to reside.

Deer ticks, also known as black-legged ticks, are typically found in the eastern and midwestern US, while western black-legged ticks prefer the Pacific Coast.

What are the treatment options for alpha-gal syndrome?

There is no cure for AGS.

Symptoms, which vary from person to person, can be managed by avoiding red meat and other products containing alpha-gal.

Those with severe reactions may need to carry an epinephrine auto-injector and seek immediate medical attention.

How can alpha-gal syndrome be prevented?

The best way to prevent yourself from developing AGS is to take precautionary measures against tick bites.

  • Use insect repellant.
  • Avoid leaving trails while hiking.
  • Wear long pants and sleeves.
  • Check yourself for ticks when you get home.
  • Shower immediately after being outdoors.
item.author: Diana Bruk

item.description:
There‚Äôs a scaredy cat in the concrete jungle.¬†

Keeping your wits about you while on the streets of NYC is wise. But being so afraid of getting mugged or drugged that you can‚Äôt enjoy the city so-nice-they-named-it-twice is ‚Äúridiculous,‚Äù according to the online critics of¬†one terrified tourist.¬†

‚ÄúStay safe in New York,‚Äù Victoria, a notoriously overly cautious mom, captioned a viral vid of her anti-crime hacks during a visit to the Big Apple, where shootings and other malfeasances have recently reached a record low.

‚ÄúI‚Äôll share some tips that helped me stay aware and enjoy the city without any issues,‚Äù the married mom announced to her over 7.8 million TikTok viewers ‚Äî many of whom were unmoved, and even offended, by Victoria‚Äôs panicked precautions.¬†

From weaving the strap of her purse between her thighs to ensure that no ruffians made off with the handbag while she sipped coffee outdoors near Times Square, to barricading the door of her hotel room with towels, clothes hangers and an upturned ironing board for fear of nighttime trespassers, the blond took safeguarding to excessive extremes.¬†

And annoyed New Yorkers let her know it.¬†

‚ÄúGirl, New York is NOT this dangerous,‚Äù an irked commenter assured.¬†¬†

‚ÄúAre you ok?‚Äù a concerned viewer asked sarcastically, followed by a separate spectator declaring, ‚ÄúThis is ridiculous.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen your pearls are clutched so tight you don‚Äôt enjoy New York,‚Äù another noted.¬†

‚ÄúI live in NYC, you don‚Äôt need all that,‚Äù argued a native, ‚Äúeveryone minds their own business.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs New York, not Gotham,‚Äù joked another, reminding Victoria that the five boroughs aren‚Äôt nearly as bad as Batman‚Äôs danger-ridden home city.¬†

‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre that scared, don‚Äôt go,‚Äù an onlooker spat.¬†

Snide remarks from the cyber cynics aside, a faction of folks on the internet actually applauded Victoria‚Äôs hyper-vigilance.¬†

Fans¬†were most supportive of the mother‚Äôs move to strap an Apple AirTag bracelet to her six-year-old son‚Äôs wrist during an evening stroll around midtown, where slashings and kidnappings still abound, despite improvements in public safety.¬†

‚ÄúGreat tips! Staying aware while exploring New York is key to making the most of the experience. Thanks for sharing your insights!‚Äù praised a prudent tripper.¬†

‚ÄúLiterally the only thing that made any sense to me was the AirTag for the kid,‚Äù added another, slightly less impressed commenter, ‚Äúeverything else is so unnecessary.‚Äù¬†
item.author: Asia Grace

item.title: Á∫ΩÁ∫¶‚ÄúÈÜíÊù•‚ÄùÁöÑÂçÅÂ≠óÂÜõÂú®ÂèØÊÄïÁöÑÂ®ÅËÉÅ„ÄÅËÇÆËÑèÁöÑÁîµÂ≠êÈÇÆ‰ª∂‰∏≠Ëá™Áî±Ë°åËµ∞Ôºö ‚ÄúÊàë‰∏çÂêéÊÇî‰ªª‰Ωï‰∫ãÊÉÖ‚Äù
item.description:
A judge finally ordered ‚Äúwoke‚Äù crusader Anne Marie Bompart to be hauled off by cops to Bellevue for a mental health evaluation after unsettling media posts about getting a gun and burning down her haters‚Äô homes ‚Äî and nude pics she sent to the press covering her case.

But despite the inpatient evaluation order, which can mean being held for days, Bompart was free hours later, and posted several videos of herself walking the streets of New York City, proclaiming victory.

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt kill me and you can‚Äôt silence me,‚Äù boasted Bompart, who was also let off the hook after making physical contact inside a courtroom with a bar manager suing the crusader, despite a restraining order against her.

She added that the evaluation at the city‚Äôs psych ward at Bellevue Hospital, where she was brought in handcuffs hours earlier, ‚Äúwent as expected,‚Äù and said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm fine, not crazy.‚Äù

Bompart also praised her civil court judge, James d‚ÄôAuguste, as ‚Äúcool,‚Äù adding that ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt regret anything.‚Äù

Bompart‚Äôs incessant emailing has ramped up so intensely that d‚ÄôAuguste extended an existing restraining order to include attorney Tom Shanahan, who is repping the two Sapphic bars who sued Bompart over a year ago for defamation and harassment.¬†

‚ÄúI‚Äôm bringing my own kerosene from NYC,‚Äù Bompart wrote in a recent Instagram post where she threatened to burn down the homes of posters on a notorious message board called Kiwi Farms, who mocked her with hateful and vile comments.

‚ÄúAnd I will light my joint from the burning flames of your house which will hopefully have u in there burning to death,‚Äù the post continues, ‚Äúlol Just kidding.‚Äù¬†

In court on Wednesday, Bompart explained her threats as comments made in self-defense against hateful comments made about her online.

She explained in a rapid screed, without a hint of irony, that people ‚Äúare posting things about me,‚Äù which included suggestions of harm.¬†

‚ÄúThese are the people I‚Äôm defending myself against,‚Äù she said.

In the past, Bompart has made her own threats and allusions to violence, including promised beat-downs and stomping a pet dog to death.

Just a month ago, she praised Charlie Kirk‚Äôs murder and alluded to a ‚Äúcopycat‚Äù crime.

Back in October, Bompart sent several emails to a reporter from The Post and a freelance photographer, including roughly a handful of fully-nude photographs of herself.¬†

Her attorney, Gerard Lucciola, argued on Wednesday that Bompart‚Äôs monologue was a sign of her sanity, and that she should be let go, since ‚Äúshe has cooperated the entire time.‚Äù

When the judge asked if there was a factual dispute over Bompart sending ‚Äúemails with threats,‚Äù Lucciola called the messages ‚Äústale.‚Äù

‚ÄúIf this court does not act, I think blood is going to flow in the streets of the West Village, because she hasn‚Äôt let this go,‚Äù Shanahan said. ‚ÄúFor two years, nobody has responded to anything‚Ä¶ And yet she keeps going.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe fact that she said ‚ÄòI have to defend myself from you and everybody else‚Äô just shows that she‚Äôs not clearly in touch with reality,‚Äù Shanahan said.

As she was cuffed at the hearing‚Äôs close ‚Äî a repeat of last January ‚Äî she screamed insults at Shanahan, calling him ‚Äúdisgusting and slimy‚Äù and a pedophile.¬†

If courts find her sane, then the $40 million defamation lawsuit will proceed, starting with what Shanahan calls her 200 contempt order violations.

Each violation could result in a max penalty of 30 days in jail and a $1,000 fine, meaning Bompart‚Äôs spamming could theoretically cost her 16 years in the clink and $200,000 in fines.
item.author: Peter Senzamici, Steven Hirsch

item.description:
This game will be talked about on the seven seas for some time.

It‚Äôs all lock and focus at Kings Point as the 6-2 United States Merchant Marine Academy is shipping up to Boston to do battle with its bitter rival, the 7-2 United States Coast Guard Academy, at Fenway Park on Saturday.

What‚Äôs on the line for the two Division III arch adversaries, who become trusted comrades on the water, is the pride and joy of hoisting the coveted Secretaries‚Äô Cup ‚Äî along with blissful nautical bragging rights.

‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs the DIII Army-Navy game,‚Äù Mariners senior linebacker Deryk Leverage told The Post.

‚ÄúWe could go undefeated, we could lose every game, but this game is, to us, the highest on our list,‚Äù he added of playing the New London, Conn.-based Bears, who are celebrating the Coast Guard‚Äôs 235th anniversary.

The cross-Long Island Sound sports enemies have faced off 53 times as the Merchant Marine leads the series 37-16, but have lost the past two renditions.

‚ÄúAfter a loss, it definitely sucks,‚Äù Leverage said of being at sea for months afterward.

‚ÄúEspecially if we have Coast Guard guys on our ship, they‚Äôll definitely be bringing it up every now and then.‚Äù

Making waves

The rivalry‚Äôs ferocious intensity has been somewhat obscure, said Mariners head coach Jameson Croall.

‚ÄúThere are people who grew up on Long Island that don‚Äôt even really know [Kings Point] is here, not to mention all over the United States,‚Äù added the team‚Äôs skipper, who himself was aloof to the contention before taking the job in 2012.

That all changed in Year 1 when Coast Guard drove down to Kings Point to shoot a ‚Äúprank video‚Äù on campus.

‚ÄúThey brought their bear costume down ‚Äî and one of our midshipmen, who wasn‚Äôt a football player, stole it out of their truck,‚Äù recalled Croall, who‚Äôs beaten the Bears nine times in his tenure.

‚ÄúThat bear head ended up in the middle of our regiment as we marched on to the field. That caused a ruckus‚Ä¶ And I just remember being like, ‚ÄòOh, this is a little bit different than anything I‚Äôm used to.‚Äô ‚Äù

He said the two sides have adopted a more shipshape approach over the years as the game has gained more nationwide attention, thanks to being broadcast on ESPN, which gives both academies‚Äô athletes excellent exposure.

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to screw that up with some shenanigans,‚Äù joked the coach, who has a Fenway Park sign near his office for the team to visualize the big moment ahead.

‚ÄúAll we want to do is spotlight how special our place is,‚Äù Croall added of the only federal service academy where graduates can commission into any military branch.

Uncharted waters

Another unique element takes a mental toll on USMMA players in what is typically their final game of the year.

‚ÄúAs soon as we are done with our season, most of us will get sent out,‚Äù junior linebacker Aidan Graham said of what‚Äôs typically eight months at sea at any given port around the globe on military or commercial crafts.

‚ÄúWe had players last time go out the night of the Coast Guard game ‚Äîguys flying out to Japan that night,‚Äù he added of the short-notice assignments.

The anticipation of being stationed is even more last-minute this time, as the Mariners wait to see if they will be playing in a bowl game following the Coast Guard matchup.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard to stay focused on the task at hand because you know that our world is going to change,‚Äù he added.

Returning players also have to find a way to manage their fitness regimen while on the water, no matter what kind of training equipment awaits them on their ships.

Sometimes they can luck out with a ‚ÄúGold‚Äôs Gym‚Äù on board, but other times, ‚Äúit‚Äôs a four-foot ceiling with just a bench and no weights,‚Äù according to Leverage.

‚ÄúI had to do sprints, and I had to do speed work on our flight deck. I had about 50 feet to work in,‚Äù said Graham, who is vying to become a Navy SEAL.

‚ÄúI was running up and down, timing myself, doing whatever I could to keep myself in shape.‚Äù

It‚Äôs all the more reason to bring the cup back to Nassau County this weekend before boarding vessels with Coast Guard personnel on board.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a lot nicer going out on a ship when we win,‚Äù said Leverage.
item.author: Alex Mitchell

item.description:
These bargain prices come with a buzz!

The state Cannabis Control Board green-lit new advertising, packaging and marketing rules Thursday allowing licensed pot merchants to sell discounted products.

The rules say cannabis sellers can offer ‚Äúdiscounts, coupons, points-based reward systems, customer loyalty programs, bundled discounts.‚Äù

Regulators had first proposed lifting the ban on discounts last year and gave final approval at Thursday‚Äôs meeting.

The weed dealers have been asking for such authority since the industry launched three years ago.

Discounted prices on cannabis gummies, oils and flowered marijuana can now be offered to veterans, seniors and young adults over 21, said joyous weed dealers.

That could mean buying two 10-packs of pre-rolled joints for the price of one, among other sales.

‚ÄúThese changes pave the way for dispensaries to operate more like other retail sectors, enabling them to show appreciation for their customers, build loyalty, and differentiate themselves in a competitive market,‚Äù said Empire Cannabis Manufacturing Alliance President Mack Hueber.

He thanked Gov. Kathy Hochul and cannabis regulators for listening to the growing legal marijuana industry.

One operator said he intends to immediately offer discounts to veterans in honor of the just past Veterans‚Äô Day.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs amazing. It‚Äôs long overdue,‚Äù said Osbert Orduna, a military vet himself who runs The Cannabis Place in Middle Village, Queens.

He said his other cannabis store in New Jersey always had the authority to offer discounted sales on merchandise.

‚ÄúThese new rules normalize the cannabis industry. It gives us the right that other businesses have to offer discounts,‚Äù Orduna said.
item.author: Carl Campanile
